topic: AI Memory Systems with Filesystem-Based Interfaces

change_log.summary: MCP integration explicitly out of scope
changes: Updated strategy to focus on Bash-native access patterns
Emphasized that LLMs perform best with filesystem tools they were trained on
Positioned organic growth via documentation and community engagement
GitHub Copilot agentic memory in public preview (Jan 15)
VentureBeats 2026 predictions: agentic memory now table stakes

elicitation.decision_context: Academic validation, strategic planning, and feature roadmap for mnemonic
elicitation.prior_knowledge: Mnemonic uses filesystem-based storage with MIF Level 3 format, YAML frontmatter, markdown content, git integration
elicitation.anti_patterns: Recommendations that require departing from filesystem simplicity

research_areas.focus: POSIX tools, plain text storage, git integration, ripgrep search
MCP ecosystem, multi-agent memory, context management standards
Cognitive science memory models, temporal reasoning, decay functions

findings.finding: Letta benchmark proves filesystem-based memory outperforms specialized tools: 74.0% accuracy vs Mem0's 68.5% on LoCoMo benchmark
findings.source: Letta AI Research - Benchmarking AI Agent Memory
findings.implications: Strong validation that mnemonic's filesystem approach is not just simpler but potentially more effective than vector/graph alternatives

findings.finding: LLMs have extensive pretraining on filesystem operations, making simple tools more reliable than specialized knowledge graphs
findings.implications: Agents using familiar tools (read, write, grep) are more reliable than those using novel retrieval mechanisms

findings.finding: Arxiv paper 'From Everything is a File to Files Are All You Need' validates Unix philosophy for agentic AI systems
findings.implications: Academic validation that collapsing diverse interfaces into uniform file abstraction is a proven strategy for managing complexity

findings.finding: ripgrep provides 5-10x performance improvement over GNU grep, particularly with line numbers enabled
findings.implications: mnemonic's reliance on ripgrep is well-founded; can confidently scale to large memory collections

findings.finding: Git-based knowledge management provides version control, conflict resolution, and offline access that databases cannot match
findings.implications: Git integration is a genuine differentiator for audit trails and collaboration

findings.finding: Bash-native access is sufficient for AI assistant integration; LLMs perform best with filesystem tools they were trained on
findings.implications: Mnemonic requires no protocol integration; any Bash-capable AI assistant can use it directly
findings.note: MCP integration explicitly out of scope per project decision

findings.finding: Cursor and Windsurf both lack native persistent memory; community has built 'Memory Bank' workarounds using markdown files
findings.source: Cursor Forum, Windsurf Docs, GitHub memory-bank projects
findings.implications: Market gap exists that mnemonic can fill; existing workarounds validate the markdown-file approach

findings.finding: GitHub Copilot agentic memory now in public preview (Jan 15, 2026): cross-agent memory sharing with 7% PR merge rate improvement, 28-day auto-expiry, citation-based validation
findings.implications: Cross-agent memory is production-ready at GitHub scale; mnemonic's approach validated by industry leader

findings.finding: Multi-agent memory sharing is emerging pattern with 4 major protocols: MCP, ACP, A2A, ANP
findings.implications: mnemonic's blackboard pattern for cross-session coordination is ahead of curve; extend to multi-agent

findings.finding: Mem0 claims 26% accuracy improvement and 90% lower token usage vs full-context approaches
findings.implications: Memory layer approach is validated; mnemonic can achieve similar benefits with simpler implementation

findings.finding: Cognitive science memory types (semantic, episodic, procedural) are being directly applied in AI agent architectures
findings.source: Medium articles, arxiv papers on AI memory surveys
findings.implications: mnemonic's three memory types are academically grounded and align with emerging standards

findings.finding: Bi-temporal data modeling (valid time vs transaction time) has SQL:2011 standard backing
findings.implications: mnemonic's temporal model follows established database theory; opportunity to enhance temporal queries

findings.finding: Ebbinghaus forgetting curve research being applied to neural networks; decay modeling shown to enhance training efficiency
findings.source: arxiv paper on human-like forgetting curves in DNNs
findings.implications: mnemonic's decay modeling has academic foundation; could enhance with smarter decay scheduling

findings.finding: Context compression research shows 6:1 compression with >90% semantic fidelity is achievable
findings.source: Medium article on Context Extension Protocol
findings.implications: Opportunity for mnemonic to implement context compression for memory summaries

findings.finding: Simplicity correlates with reliability: simpler tools in LLM training data are used more effectively by agents
findings.implications: mnemonic's POSIX tool approach is a feature not a limitation; complexity is actually a liability

findings.finding: Iterative querying advantage: agents can generate own queries and continue searching, transforming retrieval into exploration
findings.implications: mnemonic could enhance search with agent-driven iterative refinement capabilities

findings.finding: Personal science wiki research shows structured documentation in shared repos improves consensus knowledge building
findings.implications: mnemonic could position for team/org knowledge sharing beyond individual AI assistant use

findings.finding: Integration guides for Cursor, Windsurf, Copilot using Bash-native access patterns
findings.implications: Focus on documentation and rules files that leverage native filesystem access
findings.note: MCP integration explicitly out of scope

findings.finding: Citation-based memory validation (like GitHub Copilot) could prevent stale memory usage
findings.implications: Add optional citation fields that can be validated against current codebase

findings.finding: Memory compression/summarization for context window efficiency is emerging pattern
findings.implications: Add auto-summarization capability that preserves semantic content while reducing tokens
